results.description: The 3 Musketeers--marshmallows, espresso, and chocolate–combine to make this hot, frothy delight.

instructions.display_text: In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk and marshmallows and bring to a low simmer, stirring until the marshmallows melt, 3–5 minutes.
Pour the milk mixture into a large mug, along with the espresso.
Top with chocolate whipped cream, chocolate syrup, and red and blue sprinkles.
Serve immediately.
Enjoy!

Attention all soccer (and food) fans! Watching a soccer match is never complete without some fun and filling snacks to munch on... as you cross your fingers and hope your team wins, the tension can get high and we suggest that instead of biting your nails why don't you try some of our bite-sized bbq-popcorn-chicken ! Or celebrate the win with some funnel-cake-fries ! Whether your team wins or loses, rest assured you'll "taste" victory!
compilations.name: Soccer Time Snacks!

compilations.description: Let's shine a spotlight to everyone's favorite side dish and explore some different types of fries! Garlic Parmesan Baked Carrot Fries are the perfect balance of tasty and healthy. Need a snack? Try some Baked Sweet Potato Fries! Ever had fries for dessert? You'll seriously enjoy the Funnel Cake Fries after a delicious meal!
compilations.name: Fries Done 6 Ways

compilations.description: We've got our eyes on the fries with these recipes. If you love Indian spice and heat, try our super flavorful Masala Fries. If you want fries, but also dig protein, you’ve gotta dig into our Chicken Fries Poutine! And of course, if you have a sweet tooth, you'll absolutely love our Funnel Cake Fries!.
compilations.name: 3 Fry Recipes Like No Other!

instructions.display_text: Make the strawberry dipping sauce: Add the strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice to a small pot over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes, until thickened. Remove the pot from the heat and set aside until ready to serve.

Make the caramel dipping sauce: Add the sugar to a small pan over medium heat. Without stirring, cook the caramel for about 10 minutes, swirling the pan occasionally to loosen any clumps of sugar. Once the sugar turns dark amber in color, remove the pot from the heat. Add the butter and heavy cream and whisk to combine. Be careful as the mixture will bubble up and could burn you. 3. Add the salt and stir to combine. Remove the pan from the heat and set aside until ready to serve.
Make the fries: Heat 1 inch (2.5 cm) of oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat until it reaches 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add the milk and eggs to the dry ingredients. With a rubber spatula, stir until fully incorporated.
Transfer the batter to a clean squeeze bottle.

Working one at a time, squeeze the batter into hot oil. Cook for 30-45 seconds on each side until golden brown. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper wire rack over a baking tray.
Make the marshmallow dipping sauce: Add the marshmallows and butter to a microwave-safe bowl and microwave for 1 minute in 30-second intervals, stirring until smooth.
Make the chocolate dipping sauce: Add the chocolate chips and coconut oil to a microwave-safe bowl and microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring between, until melted.
Dust the funnel cake fries with powdered sugar and serve with the dipping sauces.
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: 1 quart neutral oil, such as canola or vegetable, for frying
components.extra_comment: such as canola or vegetable, for frying

components.raw_text: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature

results.name: Funnel Cake Fries
results.description: At Tasty, we put the “fun” in funnel cake! In this sweet spin on french fries, we’re turning funnel cake into finger food! Serve these fries with four delicious dipping sauces to take this dessert to the next level.
results.keywords: carnival food, desserts to share with friends, fried foods at home, fun desserts, funnel cake fries, how to make a funnel cake, rodeo food, tasty, tastysinglerecipe, unique treats

beans, black coffee, caffeine, cake, cheese, cheesecake, chocolate, cocoa powder, coffee, coffee beans, cream cheese, eggs, espresso, mascarpone, sugar, tasty, tasty_vegetarian, tiramisu, vanilla extract

instructions.display_text: Dip the ladyfingers in coffee.
In two spring form pans lined with parchment paper, layer the coffee-dipped lady fingers in a single layer.
Freeze until the ladyfingers are frozen.
In a bowl, add the cream cheese, mascarpone cheese, and vanilla extract. Stir to combine.
Add the milk, sugar, and gelatin to a bowl and whisk until the gelatin has dissolved.
Pour the milk mixture through a sieve into the bowl of cream cheese.
Pour 1 cup (290 g) of cheesecake batter into a springform pan. Refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours
Add one layer of frozen ladyfingers on top of the refrigerated cheesecake layer.
Add another cup (290 g) of cheesecake batter on top. Refrigerate for two hours, and repeat with remaining batter and ladyfinger layer.
Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm.
Dust the top with cocoa powder.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: 8 Elegant Desserts You Can Make At Home

compilations.description: Hey there! You look like you've had a long day. How about taking a break and spending some time drooling over some stunning & delicious cheesecakes? Try an assortment of quick & easy no bake cheesecakes and or test your baking skills with this super fancy cheesecake tower! Turn up that microwave and let's start baking!
compilations.name: Ultimate Cheesecake Marathon
Coffee Lovers Only
compilations.description: Do you want to make your favorite coffee into something even better? We have curated a few unique coffee recipes that will do just that. You can even use coffee for your lunch like in a batch of Singapore Coffee Ribs or enjoy a relaxing drink like the Cold Brew Martini. Share this video and let others know there is so much more to coffee than you think!
Tasty Cafe: Treat yourself to a decadent morning with these amazing recipe pairings for your 3 Musketeers-Inspired Marshmallow Macchiato.
compilations.name: Recipes To Daydream About

compilations.description: Do you want to take your regular coffee up a notch? We’ve curated 28 different coffee recipes just for the coffee lover in you! Whether you're in need of a quick energy boost or you just want to sip on Avocado Cold Brew while you cozily read a book, this spectrum of recipes will not disappoint. Have a brew-tiful day!
compilations.name: 28 Coffee Recipes
Desserts For Coffee Lovers
compilations.description: How many ways can you drink your coffee? Having our coffee in desserts, is our favorite way to go! Swap out your cuppa for a mocha french toast bake for breakfast. End your meal with a mocha nanaimo bar and munch on a pumpkin-spice latte cinnamon roll for the perfect mid-day pick me up. Have a 'brew-tiful' day!

We've got a sweet surpise just for you - actually we have multiple, and they're from all around the world! You don't need an occasion to add decadent and sweet-filled recipes to your dessert menu. From España's Double Chocolate Stuffed Churros to Portugal's Custard Tarts, we have a whole bunch of tasty treats. The hardest part? You won't be able to pick a favorite: we know we couldn't!
compilations.name: Sweet Treats Around The World
Cheesecake 101
compilations.description: Welcome, to cheesecake Heaven. It's luscious, indulgent, glorious, and oh-so-creamy. The thing is – it's all in your hands – but not to fear, that's where we come in. We have it all, from our 5-Minute Microwave Cheesecake for a quick, nighttime indulgence, to our ultimate Spiced Chocolate Cheesecake Jar./a> What's your pick? (You can have them all too, it's allowed).

One of our favourite Italian exports is the decadent, coffee-laden tiramisu. The blend of coffee, sugar, mascarpone and cocoa is unbeatable, and we've got enough iterations to keep your coffee-craved heart satiated always. Whether you make a cheesecake out of it or pair the classic flavors with a brownie base, we've got it all. Personally, we'd pair it all with a salted caramel macchiato for an extra coffee kick. Grab a spoon, an open mind, and get scooping!
compilations.name: Tiramisu Lovers Only
Recipes For People Who Swear By Coffee
compilations.description: To all the coffee fanatics out there, welcome to paradise. We're introducing our delicious coffee tour, with Tasty's most sought after coffee recipes. Choose from our easy cinnamon coffee or spend an entire day in the kitchen baking an epic tiramisu cheesecake. These recipes will keep you fresh and buzzed, all day long!

compilations.name: 7 Days 7 Ways To Have Coffee Desserts
compilations.description: Calling all coffee lovers, because we’ve got the perfect lineup for you. Try this viral TikTok-inspired dalgona pie, or take a classic to the next level with our tiramisu cheesecake. Our mocha nanaimo bars are severely underrated and super easy to make. These coffee-infused desserts are absolutely brew-tiful.

compilations.name: Drink your coffee and eat it too!

compilations.description: Everyone loves coffee, right? You do too? Well, we've got something just for you! We've got edible coffee: introducing a lineup of our coffee-based desserts that'll have you drooling in no time. From the tiramisu cheesecake to the mocha peppermint cannolis, we're here to help you get your caffeine fix.
compilations.name: Why Drink Coffee When You Can EAT It?!

instructions.display_text: Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C).
Separate the egg yolks from the egg whites. Save the yolks for later.
Using an electric hand whisk, whisk on a high speed until soft peaks form.
Fold in salt and pepper.
Spoon the egg whites onto a baking tray and make a well in the middle, for the yolks to go in later. Bake for 8-10 minutes.
Drop the yolks into the whites and bake for a further 3 minutes.
Serve on toast or with sides of your choice.
Enjoy!

10 Easy Egg Recipes You'll Crave Everyday
compilations.description: You’re an egg-celent chef, we all know it, but sometimes that egg carton that’s lurking in the back of your fridge can throw even the best of chefs for a loop. After all, how many omelets can you eat? That’s why we’re here to switch it up, challenging you with some egg-citing recipes like an Israeli shakshouka or even a keto-friendly egg noodle! Time to egg-sperience egg heaven. (Ok, we’re done now, promise).

Whip up a some healthy avocado egg cups or impress everyone with your cooking skills with this Instagram-worthy cloud eggsrecipes. Crack those shells and have an egg-cellent day!

compilations.description: Who says waking up has to be hard? Pick from these delicious breakfast options and make hopping out of bed so much more fun! Devour the perfect fluffy pancakes or whip up some classic cloud eggs and start your day on a good note with these fancy ham and egg breakfast braids. Why shouldn't mornings be full of flavor!

compilations.description: Is breakfast your favorite meal of the day? Make your mornings more fun with these healthy and delicious breakfast recipes. From insta-worthy Cloud Eggs to the filling banana pancakes, there's something for every taste bud. So go ahead, take your pick and start your day on a happy note!

compilations.description: Some days we just want to start the day slowly. Take a bite out of the decadent Mocha Toast Bake as the morning sunshine spills through your window. Looking for something light and healthy? The Cloud Eggs are a quick and easy fix. You can also split a stack of some Fluffy Pancakes with your loved one while cuddled in your blankets. Cheers to breakfast in bed!

compilations.name: An 'Egg-cellent' Way To Start Your Day!
compilations.description: If you have a few extra minutes in the A.M., make yourself some hearty Eggs Florentine Domes. For a more rushed day, fall back on the classic omelette or some pretty cloud eggs. You can also mix it up with tortilla de patata. There's nothing like a serving of eggs to kickstart your day!
